thread.title: 18 of the Best Nachos in Chicago, Mapped
thread.title_full: 18 of the Best Nachos in Chicago, Mapped

author: Jaison Chahwala
title: 18 of the Best Nachos in Chicago, Mapped
text:
18 of the Best Nachos in Chicago, Mapped All Jan 23, 2017, 3:00pm CST Little Goat's "Machos Nachos" Facebook 
Anyone who doesn't love nachos is probably "nacho" friend. And perhaps anyone that doesn't love cheesy jokes is in the same boat — maybe. Often reserved as an appetizer to hold you and your friends over until the main attraction arrives, nachos have grown into an attraction of their own. 
Chefs and restaurateurs alike have taken notice of the rising popularity of this shareable and very social dish. Chips, cheese, and jalapenos were often the mainstay of this well-liked platter for ages, but as popularity grew, so has an interest in some more unique toppings. So grab some friends and check these places out, which are presented in alphabetical order. 1 Benchmark 
Head over to Old Town for some slightly different flavors when it comes to nachos. The bar's signature barbacoa – slow cooked beef – nachos are dressed with pico de gallo, fresh Chihuahua cheese and salsa rojo. It’s a great way to start your meal with your friends if you plan to share a laugh at the nearby Second City. Courtesy of Benchmark
